title: Ether Put Demand Signals Weakness After $4K Price Breakout
description: By locking in the right to sell ETH at a predetermined price, options traders are preparing for short-term weakness after the cryptocurrency hit a two-year high.

title: DOGE, SHIB Rally Eases as Bitcoin Bullishness Remains 'Elevated'
description: Bitcoin ETF inflows could lead to a “sell-side” crisis in the coming months, one market observer said.

title: Spanish court denies Worldcoin’s injunction request against regulator
description:
Sam Altman's company will have to freeze its operations in Spain for the next three months.

Worldcoin, a “globally inclusive identity and financial network” founded by OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, has failed to defend its operation in Spain through legal action. The company filed an injunction against the local regulator’s order to cease data collection in the country, but the court declined to grant it. 

On March 6, The Spanish Agency for the Protection of Data (AEPD) issued a temporary order prohibiting Worldcoin from data collection in the country for three months. The AEPD intends to use this period for investigating complaints that users in Spain aren’t able to withdraw consent and that Worldcoin has allegedly collected data from minors.

Worldcoin, however, didn’t accept the allegations. It sent Cointelegraph a statement, accusing the AEPD of “circumventing EU law spreading inaccurate and misleading claims” and failing to respond to the company’s letters for months.

Read more

title: ‘Web3 Gaming Offers a Pathway to a More Inclusive and Vibrant Gaming Ecosystem’ — Weiwei Geng

title: Thomson Reuters Says It Has $8 Billion to Invest in AI

title: Spot Bitcoin ETFs: Thailand SEC adjusts rules to allow product launch

title: JPMorgan’s Dimon says he will now ‘defend your right to buy Bitcoin’

title: Macro Guru Raoul Pal Unveils Massive Price Target for Solana, Says Big Trade for Crypto Now On
